body:
### Describe the bug

While compiling using `3.13.0a3` getting error:

``` bash
Compiling src/liburing/helper.pyx because it changed.

Compiling src/liburing/type.pyx because it changed.

creating build/temp.linux-x86_64-cpython-313

gcc -fno-strict-overflow -Wsign-compare -DNDEBUG -g -O3 -Wall -fPIC -DCYTHON_TRACE_NOGIL=1 -Ilibs/liburing/src/include -I/opt/python/3.13/include/python3.13 -c src/liburing/file.c -o build/temp.linux-x86_64-cpython-313/src/liburing/file.o -Og
gcc -fno-strict-overflow -Wsign-compare -DNDEBUG -g -O3 -Wall -fPIC -DCYTHON_TRACE_NOGIL=1 -Ilibs/liburing/src/include -I/opt/python/3.13/include/python3.13 -c src/liburing/liburing.c -o build/temp.linux-x86_64-cpython-313/src/liburing/liburing.o -Og

      | ^~~~~~

      |     ^~~~~                                                                                     
src/liburing/liburing.c:1325:1: warning: ‘Py_UNICODE’ is deprecated [-Wdeprecated-declarations]       
 1325 | static CYTHON_INLINE size_t __Pyx_Py_UNICODE_strlen(const Py_UNICODE *u)                      
      | ^~~~~~                                                                                        
src/liburing/liburing.c: In function ‘__Pyx_Py_UNICODE_strlen’:                                       
src/liburing/liburing.c:1327:5: warning: ‘Py_UNICODE’ is deprecated [-Wdeprecated-declarations]       
 1327 |     const Py_UNICODE *u_end = u;                                                              
      |     ^~~~~                                                                                     
creating build/lib.linux-x86_64-cpython-313
creating build/lib.linux-x86_64-cpython-313/liburing
gcc -shared build/temp.linux-x86_64-cpython-313/src/liburing/version.o -Llibs/liburing/src -luring -o build/lib.linux-x86_64-cpython-313/liburing/version.cpython-313-x86_64-linux-gnu.so
gcc -shared build/temp.linux-x86_64-cpython-313/src/liburing/helper.o -Llibs/liburing/src -luring -o build/lib.linux-x86_64-cpython-313/liburing/helper.cpython-313-x86_64-linux-gnu.so
gcc -shared build/temp.linux-x86_64-cpython-313/src/liburing/file.o -Llibs/liburing/src -luring -o build/lib.linux-x86_64-cpython-313/liburing/file.cpython-313-x86_64-linux-gnu.so
gcc -shared build/temp.linux-x86_64-cpython-313/src/liburing/liburing.o -Llibs/liburing/src -luring -o build/lib.linux-x86_64-cpython-313/liburing/liburing.cpython-313-x86_64-linux-gnu.so
gcc -shared build/temp.linux-x86_64-cpython-313/src/liburing/type.o -Llibs/liburing/src -luring -o build/lib.linux-x86_64-cpython-313/liburing/type.cpython-313-x86_64-linux-gnu.so
gcc -shared build/temp.linux-x86_64-cpython-313/src/liburing/io_uring.o -Llibs/liburing/src -luring -o build/lib.linux-x86_64-cpython-313/liburing/io_uring.cpython-313-x86_64-linux-gnu.so
copying build/lib.linux-x86_64-cpython-313/liburing/file.cpython-313-x86_64-linux-gnu.so -> src/liburing
copying build/lib.linux-x86_64-cpython-313/liburing/helper.cpython-313-x86_64-linux-gnu.so -> src/liburing
copying build/lib.linux-x86_64-cpython-313/liburing/io_uring.cpython-313-x86_64-linux-gnu.so -> src/liburing
copying build/lib.linux-x86_64-cpython-313/liburing/liburing.cpython-313-x86_64-linux-gnu.so -> src/liburing
copying build/lib.linux-x86_64-cpython-313/liburing/type.cpython-313-x86_64-linux-gnu.so -> src/liburing
copying build/lib.linux-x86_64-cpython-313/liburing/version.cpython-313-x86_64-linux-gnu.so -> src/liburing
```
Works fine for `3.8 - 3.12`

According to https://docs.python.org/3.13/c-api/unicode.html 
> "Note:
The [Py_UNICODE](https://docs.python.org/3.13/c-api/unicode.html#c.Py_UNICODE) representation has been removed since Python 3.12 with deprecated APIs. See [PEP 623](https://peps.python.org/pep-0623/) for more information."

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

```cython
# example code
```


### Expected behaviour

_No response_

### OS

Linux

### Python version

3.13.0a3

### Cython version

3.0.8

### Additional context

_No response_

comment_data.body:
Thanks for the report. The functions in question are unused in your file, so you can safely ignore the warning for now. But we should fix it.

`__Pyx_Py_UNICODE_strlen` looks to be defined as an inline function in the standard `TypeConversions` utility code that we include everywhere.

There's also an alternative limited api definition that we should probably just remove (because `Py_UNICODE` was never part of the limited API so there's little reason to support that).

My suggestion (which I don't have time to implement right now, but can have a go next week if it's still pending is):

wrap these functions in `#ifdef __Pyx_Py_UNICODE_USED` and `define __Pyx_Py_UNICODE_USED` used if we generate any of the utility code that requires it.

Thanks @da-woods,

Just warning, there is no actual error, codes/test works fine. I reported so `Cython` is ready for `Python 3.13` release.

From what I can tell this warning is raised wherever `str`, `' "` and doc string `''' """` are used.

title: [BUG] `Py_UNICODE` is deprecated Python 3.13
